text: what's up outliers quick market update specifically on GameStop actually I'm going to start doing a few videos per week covering a couple different covered strangles that I trade and as we discussed in the introduction video specifically for GameStop I have an allocation of the portfolio that I'm using to trade a coverage strangle in GameStop and then I also have other ones in some leverage ETFs ibit for Bitcoin and those will be separate videos so the goal for today is to walk you through some updates on the position as it sits you a quick overview of what seems to be going on in GameStop because had a really good day today especially with the rest of the market showing as much weakness as it did GameStop is genuinely showing Market strength which is very very cool to see so from a quick technical overview looking at a six-month daily chart that's what's up here now we can see that it's been just kind of running up along the trend line for a little while now and it's progressively posting higher lows and higher highs which obviously is associated with an uptrend now one thing that does stick out to me when looking at GameStop specifically is this trend line is really steep what I do for things like this is I monitor the relationship between the trend line and the standard deviation channels or linear regression channels whichever I happen to have up at the time

text: stick out to me when looking at GameStop specifically is this trend line is really steep what I do for things like this is I monitor the relationship between the trend line and the standard deviation channels or linear regression channels whichever I happen to have up at the time and I look at the slope in comparison the reason for that is because when we tend to see I guess I tend to see these kinds of more aggressive moves they generally will be followed by a period of consolidation and the reason for that is this is a really aggressive growth trajectory if we take a look from Fall of last year it was around 2053 and as it closed today at 3337 that's a a big move for just about any company over that time frame so this is an aggressive move now GameStop does tend to move a little bit more aggressively than other things that we might trade on a more regular basis and to demonstrate that though I want you to take a look both at the average daily range and the average true range again for a quick reminder average daily range looks at the move of the day and then average true range encompasses the overnight gaps between Queen days so the 5-day average daily range is 6.47 the 20day is 6.6 and then the 90day is 5.98 so about six what I'm showing you is that this has become slightly larger

text: at the move of the day and then average true range encompasses the overnight gaps between Queen days so the 5-day average daily range is 6.47 the 20day is 6.6 and then the 90day is 5.98 so about six what I'm showing you is that this has become slightly larger ranges as we get shorter on our time frame that we're looking at that tends to show a little bit of volatility entering the picture this isn't significant because the difference between the 90day and the 5 day isn't massive but still that's something I pay attention to and then the same thing when I look at a 90-day average true range which is 4.65 against the 5day which is 6 so this is demonstrating that very clearly the near-term time frame is more volatile from both a price General Trend perspective but then also from an actual daily price movement perspective as well so there's not a whole lot to take away from that other than bolstering the fact that this is continuing to be an ideal candidate for something like the coverage strangle which if you're not familiar with what that strategy is I encourage you to check out the video in the description below that's the introduction to this series so that you have an idea of what I'm going to be talking about in a minute so the implied volatility is 117 very very high and on a relative basis 58 so also relatively high on

text: a 31 ratio which is about good for a longer term holding for something like this I really want to capitalize on this volatility while it's here so to do that I will ratchet up that ratio a little bit so it would be 2 depending on what you're looking at first shares 3 to two so I would have 300 shares against two short calls maximum 200 Short deless and the intention is not to get aign on those short calls so they would be managed against the long shares via aggressive management meaning I'm paying close attention to it I'm not just letting it go and seeing what happens so that I don't get assigned the risk is that I could get assigned early that is a thing especially if something like GameStop squeezes while I'm in doing this and I have short calls there is absolutely a potential for somebody that's being squeezed that has those calls to exercise them early that's the risk that I run and that's why I'm not 1 ratio I don't want to unwind the whole position I don't even want to unwind 23 but I want to make sure that I'm trading in and out of this thing so that we can generate as much money as we can based on where GameStop started the year which I'm going to track right here and we will see how we are able to progress so far the trade is performing really really
